description.narrative: The Rapid Response Initiative budget line aims to assist in minimising the loss of life and alleviating the suffering of vulnerable people in crisis situations through the rapid deployment of emergency relief supplies and highly skilled personnel.

Under this budget line, emergency relief supplies - including tents, tarpaulins, shelter kits, blankets, solar lamps, cooking sets, soap, jerry cans and water tanks - are prepositioned in UN Humanitarian Response Depots (UNHRD) around the world, and airlifted into crises to meet the immediate and most basic needs of affected communities and displaced people. Ireland also contributes annually to the continued running costs of the UNHRD network. Also under this budget line, highly skilled members of the Rapid Response Corps are deployed at short notice into crisis situations to provide much needed surge capacity in our UN Stand-by Partners’ humanitarian operations in the areas of logistics, shelter and camp management, water and sanitation, protection, gender, nutrition, humanitarian coordination and other areas.
